title: 'Sexist' chip shop boss rejects man because 'women are better and work harder'
text:

A 'sexist' chippy boss rejected a male jobseeker because he is only looking for female staff as 'women are better and work harder'.

Unemployed Jorge Gorman had applied for an order taker role at The Anchor Fish and Chips in Nottingham last week when he received the 'shocking' reply refusing to give him a chance.

The 33-year-old, who has more than 15 years' experience in the food and drinks sector, was told he would not be considered because 'women are better' for the job.

Jorge has been looking for jobs for three months to move closer to his partner, Emma, 26.

The acting manager of Anchor Fish and Chips defended his comments, claiming that it was not discrimination but only his opinion that women were better at this particular role than men.

(Image: Kennedy News and Media)

(Image: Ian Cooper/North Wales Live)

However the owner of the chippy has since said that the acting manager was wrong and that they would hire a man or woman for the role Jorge applied for.

Jorge, from Wellingborough, Northamptonshire, said: "It's shocking that it happened - they put it in writing too.

"I've been discriminated against because of my gender. They've just said no. It's sexism pure and simple. It's absolutely ridiculous to say women are more hardworking or polite. I was born female anyway.

"They're sticking by their comments too. They've put it on their own Facebook page [since deleted].

(Image: Google Maps/Kennedy News)

"They said 'in my opinion women are better on phone by taking takeaway orders of customers. They're patient, they are hard working'."

Jorge added: "My confidence hasn't been knocked because I've had some nice comments, but I've been looking for work now for the last few months. I'd clean toilets if I had to - I'm one of those people."

A man who identified himself as the acting manager of Anchor Fish and Chips, in Nottingham, admitted that it was he who wrote that they wanted to hire a woman.

The manager said: "Nothing was about discrimination - it was just a misunderstanding.

(Image: Kennedy News and Media)

"I wrote this. Basically, we have had a few guys working here answering the phone but they weren't doing the job properly.

"We have a girl who has been working with us for more than a year. So I thought it was right to have a female answer the phone talking to people. I did not know it was illegal. I did not mean to discriminate against people.

"I couldn't post the advert just for a female. In my opinion, females do this job [order taking] better than male staff. I just said 'in my opinion'. I didn't say it was a fact."

(Image: Getty Images)



The owner of The Anchor Fish and Chips said: "We don't only hire female staff - we've got lots of male staff.

"I'll definitely do something about this. That's not the case. It's not my opinion. I'll change my password [to our social media page]. He is not supposed to post stuff like that.

"I would be happy to hire a male or female member of staff for this job."
description: Jobseeker Jorge Gorman, 33, claims the Nottingham takeaway shunned him because he isn't female
